name: Hyatt Regency Orlando International Airport

reviews.text: Stayed overnite prior to traval the next day. Told the clerk at check in this was the first time at a Hyatt hotel. Normally stay at the JW Marriott. Was given a room far from the elevator overlooking a parking lot. Room was clean with the exception of the bed skirt on the window side of the bed. Appeared to be a stain of some sort. The room was large with a large bathroom, however the room and bathroom could have cleaner. There were water stains on the counter in the bathroom and bits of lint on the carpet. With the price of the room (159.00 plus tax) I would have expected more.
reviews.title: Overnite stay

reviews.text: It was quiet but no wireless Internet available.
reviews.title: Fantastic choice for an early flight

reviews.text: We dined in the hemisphere restaurant that evening with the food being top notch. The server Sherry was also on top of her game. The meal with wine for myself and my wife well exceeded the hotel room bill, but was worth it. We traval extensively and stay at a variety of hotels. The Hyatt was a disappointment, but the restaurant would have been with the trip itself. Good food, good service. I don't know if I would stay here agin with so many other hotels with shuttles to the airport nearby, but would certainly go back to the restaurant.
reviews.title: "Great airport Hotel"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have now stayed at this hotel 3 times, each time being the night before an early flight. Despite the hotel being located within the airport, the rooms are quiet (even those with a runway view) and comfortable so ideal when you know you need to get a good night's sleep. This time, the only negative things I would mention is that the housekeeping seemed to have slipped a little - the room was quite dusty, particularly around the TV and bedside units also the glass panel in the bathroom door was covered in child size handprints of what looked like shower gel/suncream - really obvious so not just an easy oversight. Also no matter when you turn up there always seems to be a wait at the receiption desk. The pool is also very cold!
reviews.title: Very Convenient!

reviews.text: We stayed here for a night after flying in to Orlando and starting our vacation the next day. The rooms are nice and reasonably clean with large balconies. Even though it is an airport hotel we found it quiet. The pool was nice with no crowds and it was fun to watch the planes take off from the pool area. Lots of food choices nearby. The gym was good but the treadmill did not seem as good as the one I have at home. Front desk staff was friendly. The location was very convenient and a big plus. The hotel is expensive but worth it for the convenience. Would stay here again and recommend to friends.
reviews.title: Convenient hotel

reviews.text: Super nice staff, GREAT food, all located right outside the TSA. When taking an early flight, this is the ONLY way to go. Why take a shuttle from a nearby hotel to the airport, when you can stay right outside security! Nice rooms and a great price!
reviews.title: Great Property

reviews.text: My family recently took a Disney Cruise. We used airline miles for our flights. I was really pleased at the way this hotel catered to people taking a cruise. I let them know we were taking a cruise the next day and the bell desk took care of our luggage right from our room. We just added the cruise provided ID tags to our luggage and the bell desk took care of the rest. The next time we saw our bags they were just outside our cabin on the Disney Magic. The airport has plenty of places to eat and when we called the front desk they were able to give us a phone number of a pizza place that delivered to the hotel also. Access to the hotel is difficult for the Pizza Delivery company so you have to meet them at the ground level car port. Our kids really enjoyed the pool area. We were not bothered by airport noise. We stayed a night after the cruise also and the concierge was very helpful. We wanted to do something the day we got off of the ship and she gave us several options and even checked us into our Soutwest Airlines flight and got us our A line number. Once we deiced what we wanted to do she set up transportation for us.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for Cruising.

reviews.text: This is easily the best hotel in an airport terminal that I have stayed at. We stayed here for 2 nights in 2 rooms. It was at the end of a trip and we stayed here with plans to go to Disney World for a day. The rate we had was more than reasonable. Almost too cheap for a hotel of this quality! Check in was quick and easy. We inquired with the concierge on transportation to Disney World and while there are shuttles available, she was able to book us a dirt cheap car rental for the day which made it cheaper than any shuttle available. The rooms were outside facing rooms versus atrium facing. They were larger than a normal hotel room and had large balconies. The bathrooms were way larger than a typical hotel bathroom with separate tub and shower. There was also 2 separate sinks which was nice so no one was in each others way. There is also a decent size pool outside. We had breakfast in the hotel restaurant one day and took advantage of the buffet. The prices were in line with most hotel breakfast buffet's. If you do not want to eat in the hotel, since it is in the main airport terminal you can easily go to one of the sit down or fast food restaurants available there. Overall, this is a great hotel and very convenient.
reviews.title: Best In Terminal Hotel I've Stayed At

reviews.text: Booked here after cancelling at a different hotel with several issues. WOW what a great find. We were traveling with a 15 month old and this was a life saver in the morning to make our flight. Clean, spacious rooms and lovely bathrooms with a huge tub. Sturdy cribs for the baby with clean sheets and a blanket. In room fridge for milk storage and snacks. Wonderful front desk clerk, super friendly, happy and genuinely concerned for our needs. Take the elevator downstairs into the airport for a full food court (open at 0430), a 24 hour Starbucks and lots of shops to browse through.
reviews.title: Great room & very convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will be staying here with every trip in and out of Florida.
reviews.title: Convenient location for an early flight
Best Convenience for a Morning Flight
reviews.text: Our family of four stayed here on the Friday before Easter to have a relaxing night before a morning flight to return home, and I have concluded that staying at an airport hotel should be considered a best practice for families. Our stay at the Orlando Airport Hyatt was very relaxing and convenient. The property was clean, comfortable, updated and staffed with top-notch guest centric staff. I have stayed at a lot of Hyatts over time and have found their system to be very inconsistent in quality-service-cleanliness from hotel to hotel, but this one is a good one (other great picks are Gainey Ranch in AZ and the one on Poipu Beach Kauai - the best in my opinion). When I arrived in the Orlando airport I stopped at the Hyatt front desk and made my reservation for the following week's night before my departure. The front desk staff member was very nice, but lacking in some training on making reservations (she probably does mainly check-ins). Her colleague helped her and I was assured that a room with two double beds was being reserved. Upon check-in, I was told that my reservation was for a king bed room and that there were no doubles available in the hotel. I explained to the front desk person that with four people it was unacceptable, that I was told that a double had been reserved and I could not understand why/how this happened. She was pleasant and offered a larger room with a sofa bed and the option to bring a rollaway into the room ... all at a 70% room rate premium to what I had reserved. I told her that I would take the room, but it would need to be at the original rate that was listed in my reservation. To my delight, she was empowered to say "yes" and she made the change. The rest of the check-in process was very expedient and were quickly in our room. The room was very spacious and well-appointed. Within minutes, a knock at the door and the rollaway appeared. I called down to room service to order a bottle of wine (by the way, their wine selection could use a make-over) and was told it could take up to 40 minutes to receive. Once again, they over-delivered and the wine showed-up in less than ten minutes. Each time we interacted with a Hyatt employee we were treated with respect and the service was prompt and friendly -- I cannot ask for more. The bed was comfortable and the room was exceptionally sound-proof from the airport ... we did not hear one jet all night. We went to the pool on the sixth floor and it was fine, but there was no hot tub and I think all hotels should have one. The next morning, we had a Starbucks close by in the food and shopping area just outside the hotel entrance and all was good with the world. Seriously, this was probably the easiest and least stressful travel morning I have ever had and it causes me to wish that every airport had a hotel in their terminals.

reviews.title: 1night stopover
reviews.text: We arrived late from las Vegas so we decided to stay at the Hyatt in the airport, we had seen the hotel many times while flying through Orlando.

reviews.title: In Airport - walk to ticket counter, gate
reviews.text: The room was very comfortable with an inside balcony and a nice bathroom, we had a couple of drinks at the bar which was not really designed for anything other than diners but in saying that, the staff were very welcoming for what I'm sure is just a transit hotel.

reviews.title: looks nice and staff are great but...
reviews.text: We had a nice breakfast when it eventually arrived, even though it wasn't very busy we had a very long wait, I think American hotels like to bring you everything you've ordered all at once instead of the cereal first then the rest later which lets your cooked food go even cooler than it already is, so it was just OK!

reviews.title: This is all about the location......
reviews.text: This was my fourth stay at this property - first review. On this trip everything worked perfectly. You work your way through the airport traffic, and arrive at the circular entrance. You have a choice of valet or self parking. In my case, after checking in I returned the car to Hertz and walked back to the room. They do have park & fly packages. As a Diamond member we had a very nice amenity package of wine and cheese with an excellent upgraded room. We live over an hour from this airport, and find the departure convenience to be well worth the cost. When situations arise where the guest is not satisfied - management is responsive in a timely manner. Resolution may not be exactly what you want, but if you give them a chance they will extend themselves to assist you.

My business frequently takes me to the Orlando airport area and I have stayed at many airport inns and hotels. This one is actually right in the airport terminal. It is a little pricey, but WOW, it is so lovely and convenient. And the restaurant, Hemisphere, was wonderful. I will go back.
reviews.title: The best airport hotel in Orlando

reviews.text: We were looking for a great place to stay the night before we went on our Disney Cruise and WDW vacation. We hadn't been in the area before and received a few recommendations with this being one of them. I give myself 2 thumbs up and an extra pat on the back for picking this place. The recommendations we received were for this Hyatt and a few at Port Canaveral. The first impression was great. We had a slight, ok, more than slight delay with flights. About 3 hours and didn't even land into Orlando until about 1:30 in the morning. Traveling alone with my 2 young kids, I can't tell you how convenient this place is. Never did I imagine I'd have the layover but to haul luggage and 2 kids through the airport was exhausting. Luckily I didn't have far to go. We got to the check in desk and that went very smooth. No hassles. The check in guy explains how the Disney Cruise luggage stuff works and we went to our room. I must say I was a little hesitant with the price but after seeing the room, it was spectacular. No noise, nothing but peace to sleep. After settling in, we only got about 4 hours sleep. Once we got up and moving about, we headed down for breakfast, again the convenience is awesome. I had to check out and I redeemed a gift voucher? and am pleased to report there were no issues with that either. The whole luggage transition and check-in was beyond easy. In fact, I had expected it to all take a little longer. So Kudos to the Hyatt. You get a lot of referrals from our cruise board and I am planning on returning again. It was a great start to a fabulous vacation.
reviews.title: Disney Cruisers Dream Stay

reviews.text: We have stayed at the hotel on a number of visits to Orlando to get a nights sleep before picking up the car. After a long flight it is great to be able to 'chill' within minutes of getting off the transit from arrivals, especially as on this trip the delay through immigration was a bit grim.
reviews.title: Great location, good service

reviews.text: The check in was painless, efficient and friendly, the beds ultra comfortable and just the tonic to adjust for the holiday ahead. We had a snack in the bar, three small plates for around $17 which were delicious and breakfast in the Hemisphere Restaurant the next morning was of a good quality and variety (buffet).
reviews.title: Couldn't be more convenient

reviews.text: My stay at the MCO Hyatt was the end of a 10 day business trip. Being able to relax without concern for making the morning flight was great. The room was comfortable and quiet,despite the airport noise. Lots of dining and beverage options both in the hotel and out in the terminal.
reviews.title: Fantastic experience

aka: Hyatt Regency Orlando International Airport Hotel
description: Our 4 diamond hotel is located inside the Orlando Intl Airport with the hotels elegant decor and artwork, combined with superior food & beverage service that makes for a luxury hotel experience 445 soundproof guest rooms and 42,000 sq ft. of flexible meeting space.
